triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: Dreamer is a reinforcement learning algorithm that learns to solve control tasks across diverse domains.

triples.name: World model
triples.relevance: The paper proposes learning world models to represent and predict environment dynamics for improved control.

triples.name: Model-based reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: Dreamer is a model-based RL approach that learns environment models and uses them to imagine future scenarios.

triples.name: Minecraft
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates Dreamer's capability by achieving diamond collection in Minecraft from pixels and sparse rewards.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Control tasks represent the core problem domain that Dreamer addresses across diverse applications.

triples.name: Normalization (machine learning)
triples.relevance: Normalization techniques are used as robustness mechanisms to enable stable learning across different domains.

triples.name: Curriculum learning
triples.relevance: The paper claims to work without curricula, highlighting Dreamer's ability to solve problems without progressive difficulty structuring.
